private_information: Map the natural language to a canonical, lowercase action set suitable for STRIPS.
Keep argument ordering exactly as shown in the descriptions.
domain_modeler.goal: Produce a canonical, machine-readable operator library from the public action descriptions.

private_information: There are two scenario statements; scenario A has a candidate plan, scenario B does not.
state_curator.goal: Assemble the two scenarios with their initial facts and goals, and include the candidate plan for scenario A without altering any facts.

private_information: Use forward simulation with STRIPS semantics: an action is applicable iff all its preconditions are true; applying it adds add-effects and removes del-effects.
plan_checker.goal: Validate the provided plan for scenario A step-by-step and report any precondition violations and the resulting state after each applicable step.

private_information: You must remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, or any artificial permission mechanism.
All effects must arise solely from applicable actions with truthfully satisfied preconditions.
consistency_auditor.goal: Audit temporal and causal consistency across the operator model and scenarios, flag ambiguities, and provide corrective notes if any action would require unstated assumptions.

private_information: Integrate the outputs from modeler, curator, and auditor.
Target the FastDownward solver with a compatible STRIPS domain and problem files.
orchestrator.goal: Emit a final PDDL domain and problem files that encode the six actions and both scenarios faithfully, ready for FastDownward.

public_information: Available actions with arities: paltry ?o0 ?o1 ?o2; sip ?o0 ?o1 ?o2; clip ?o0 ?o1 ?o2; wretched ?o0 ?o1 ?o2 ?o3; memory ?o0 ?o1 ?o2; tightfisted ?o0 ?o1 ?o2.
paltry preconditions: hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, vase object_0 object_1, next object_1 object_2.
paltry add effects: next object_0 object_2.
paltry delete effects: vase object_0 object_1.
sip preconditions: hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, next object_0 object_2, next object_1 object_2.
sip add effects: vase object_0 object_1.
sip delete effects: next object_0 object_2.
clip preconditions: hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, next object_0 object_2.
clip add effects: vase object_0 object_1.
clip delete effects: next object_0 object_2.
wretched preconditions: sneeze object_0, texture object_1, texture object_2, stupendous object_3, next object_0 object_1, collect object_1 object_3, collect object_2 object_3.
wretched add effects: next object_0 object_2.
wretched delete effects: next object_0 object_1.
memory preconditions: cats object_0, spring object_1, spring object_2, next object_0 object_1.
memory add effects: next object_0 object_2.
memory delete effects: next object_0 object_1.
tightfisted preconditions: hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, vase object_0 object_1.
tightfisted add effects: next object_0 object_2.
tightfisted delete effects: vase object_0 object_1.

Scenario A initial facts: cats object_0; collect object_5 object_1; collect object_6 object_1; collect object_7 object_2; collect object_8 object_2; hand object_9; next object_0 object_7; next object_3 object_5; next object_4 object_7; next object_9 object_7; sneeze object_3; sneeze object_4; spring object_5; spring object_7; stupendous object_1; stupendous object_2; texture object_5; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8.
Scenario A goal: next object_9 object_8.
Scenario A proposed plan: clip object_9 object_4 object_7; wretched object_4 object_7 object_8 object_2; tightfisted object_9 object_4 object_8.

Scenario B initial facts: cats object_0; collect object_5 object_1; collect object_6 object_1; collect object_7 object_2; collect object_8 object_2; hand object_9; next object_0 object_5; next object_3 object_5; next object_4 object_8; next object_9 object_6; sneeze object_3; sneeze object_4; spring object_5; spring object_7; stupendous object_1; stupendous object_2; texture object_5; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8.
Scenario B goal: next object_9 object_7.
Scenario B plan: none provided.

model.system_prompt: You are a domain-modeling expert. From natural language action descriptions and examples, produce a canonical, lowercase operator library as JSON with fields: actions (list), each action has name, parameters (ordered list like [o0, o1, o2, ...]), preconditions (list of predicate atoms), add_effects (list), del_effects (list), and a global predicates list. Do not emit PDDL; do not invent new predicates or change argument orders.
model.prompt: Your name is domain_modeler. Use the following public information to extract the six action schemas with exact preconditions and effects and list the predicates and their arities, mapping all names to lowercase and preserving argument positions; output JSON only under a top-level key model_spec.actions and model_spec.predicates: {environment->public_information}.

scenarios.system_prompt: You are a world-state curator. Build two scenario entries labeled scenario_a and scenario_b containing objects, init (set of ground atoms), goal (set of ground atoms), and for scenario_a a plan list of ground operator instances exactly as provided. Do not normalize or change the atoms; do not emit PDDL.
scenarios.prompt: Your name is state_curator. From the public information, enumerate objects object_0..object_9 and assemble scenario_a and scenario_b with their initial facts and goals; include the proposed plan for scenario_a verbatim and set scenario_b plan to an empty list: {environment->public_information}.

validate.system_prompt: You are a STRIPS plan validator. Simulate scenario_a's plan step-by-step against the provided model_spec using only the specified preconditions and effects. At each step report whether the action is applicable and why, then update the state by adding add_effects and removing del_effects. Do not fabricate facts. Output JSON with keys: valid (boolean), violations (list), trace (list of steps with before, action, applicable, reason, after).
validate.prompt: Your name is plan_checker. Validate the proposed plan for scenario_a from scenarios_spec using model_spec; produce a stepwise trace and final validity assessment; do not change action schemas or atoms: {model_spec} {scenarios_spec}.

audit.system_prompt: You audit temporal and causal consistency and remove bookkeeping shortcuts. Ensure that all claimed state changes derive only from applicable actions; identify any missing predicates, argument-order mismatches, or ambiguous naming; disallow any post-hoc penalties, quota tokens, or side accounting. Output JSON with keys: consistent (boolean), issues (list), recommendations (list), and if needed a minimally corrected view of the operator headers without changing semantics.
audit.prompt: Your name is consistency_auditor. Review the operator model, both scenarios, and the plan validation report; flag inconsistencies or hidden assumptions and provide recommendations for clean STRIPS modeling: {model_spec} {scenarios_spec} {check_report}.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL for the FastDownward solver. Integrate the operator model and scenarios to produce a final PDDL domain and two PDDL problem files (scenario_a and scenario_b). Use lowercase names, untyped or simple :typing if needed, include the predicates cats, collect, hand, next, sneeze, spring, stupendous, texture, vase with correct arities, and define the six actions paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted with exact preconditions, add-effects, and delete-effects. Enclose the PDDL domain in <domain></domain> and each problem in its own <problem name="..."></problem> tag. Target FastDownward conventions (e.g., :requirements :strips :negative-preconditions if used, provide :objects, and a single :goal conjunction). Output only these tagged PDDL artifacts.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the modeled operators and audited scenarios and produce one domain and two problem files ready for FastDownward. Keep the action schemas distinct and faithful to the descriptions, include all objects object_0..object_9, and populate the initial states and goals exactly as given; do not invent additional facts or actions; preserve argument orders from the model. Provide the domain and then problems scenario_a and scenario_b in that order, each inside <problem name="..."></problem> tags: {model_spec} {scenarios_spec} {audit_report}.
